result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald S Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Total costs in the amount of $443 to be paid by payment plan at a rate of $100 per month commencing January 27th, 2017 and to be paid on the 27th of each month thereafter.  Failure to pay will result in one day jail for each $25 owed for contempt of court.

Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
Consecutive to: other sentences

Defendant Reginald S Williams in court with attorney Rachel Marie Boaz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsle submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a guilty plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary, and finds the defendant guilty as to their plea.  State makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Counsel makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Statements by Defendant.  Court renders judgment.
Notice of Hearing-Plea/sentencing hearing: Reginald S Williams
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has been in contact with defendant who indicated his ride fell thru for today's hearing. Counsel request a stayed warrant until next date. No objection by State.  Court orders but stays warrant and forfeits bail til next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea on 15CM834. Court finds probable cause. Defendant enters not guilty plea on 15TR3706. Cases to track together.
